stateCompliance.headline: Understanding Payday Loan Laws in Texas
stateCompliance.content: Arlington residents should understand that payday loans are legal in Texas through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs). Arlington does not currently have a city-specific payday loan ordinance, so state regulations from the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC) apply.
keyPoints: Texas allows payday loans through licensed Credit Access Businesses (CABs) regulated by the Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC)
There is no state cap on interest rates or CAB fees - typical APRs range from 400% to 700%+
You have the right to cancel your loan within 3 days of signing without penalty
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment (except for fraud or theft)
Your wages cannot be garnished for payday loan debt under Texas law
Your home (if declared homestead) is protected from debt collection
Always verify your lender is licensed at occc.texas.gov before borrowing
stateCompliance.regulatoryBody: Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner (OCCC)

warningBox.title: Important Cost Warning
warningBox.content: Payday loans in Texas are among the most expensive in the nation. A typical $300 loan can cost over $1,000 in fees alone, resulting in APRs exceeding 700%. Consider alternatives such as credit union loans, payment plans with creditors, or nonprofit credit counseling before taking out a payday loan.

stateCompliance.disclaimer: This information is provided for general educational purposes only and should not be construed as legal advice. Payday loan laws and regulations change frequently. The information presented may not reflect the most current legal developments. For the most accurate and up-to-date information, contact the Texas Office of Consumer Credit Commissioner at (800) 538-1579 or visit occc.texas.gov. If you need legal advice, please consult with a licensed attorney in Texas.

cityOrdinance.headline: Arlington Payday Loan Regulations
cityOrdinance.intro: Unlike some Texas cities, Arlington does not currently have a city-specific payday loan ordinance. However, borrowers are still protected by state-level regulations:
keyProvisions: All lenders must be licensed as Credit Access Businesses with the OCCC
You have a 3-day right to cancel without penalty
All fees and terms must be disclosed before you sign
Lenders cannot threaten criminal prosecution for non-payment
cityOrdinance.note: While Arlington lacks city-specific limits, we encourage responsible borrowing and full understanding of loan terms before signing.

reviews.text: I work near AT&T Stadium and needed quick cash before my paycheck. Ace Arlington was super convenient and the process was fast. Had my money within an hour.
reviews.author: Brandon K.

reviews.text: Great location near Six Flags - easy to find and plenty of parking. The staff explained everything clearly and there were no hidden fees. Would recommend.
reviews.author: Jessica M.

reviews.text: Needed emergency funds for car repairs. The Arlington team was professional and got me approved quickly. I appreciated their honesty about the costs involved.
reviews.author: Derek W.

nearbyLocations.headline: Also Serving Nearby Cities
nearbyLocations.intro: Can't make it to our Arlington location? We also serve these nearby Texas cities:

faq.question: Where is your Arlington location?
faq.answer: Our Arlington branch is located at 2345 East Division Street, Suite 160, near AT&T Stadium and Six Flags. Take I-30 Exit 28 (AT&T Stadium) or I-20 Exit 448 (Parks Mall) for easy access.

faq.question: What are your hours in Arlington?
faq.answer: We're open Monday through Friday 9 AM to 7 PM, and Saturday 10 AM to 4 PM. We're closed on Sundays. Online applications are available 24/7.

faq.question: Does Arlington have special payday loan rules?
faq.answer: Arlington does not currently have a city-specific payday loan ordinance. State regulations from the OCCC apply, including licensing requirements and disclosure rules.

faq.question: What do I need to bring to the Arlington branch?
faq.answer: Bring a valid government-issued photo ID, proof of steady income (pay stub, bank statement, or benefits letter), your active checking account information, and a working phone number.

faq.question: How much can I borrow in Arlington?
faq.answer: Since Arlington doesn't have a city ordinance limiting loan amounts, the amount you can borrow depends on your income and our underwriting criteria. We encourage responsible borrowing.

faq.question: Can I apply online for an Arlington payday loan?
faq.answer: Yes, you can start your application online 24/7 and complete the process at our Arlington location or receive funds via direct deposit if approved.
